UFgvW4G6zglhChOXNeB2bA.text: Been to this location many times (both lunch & dinner) and the food is always good and filling.  I'm a huge fan of Indian food (both north & south) and this place is right up my alley.  Great food, great prices, speedy service...and always made to feel welcome by the friendly lady behind the counter.  I've even ordered food from here for a company luncheon event and everyone loved it.  Have taken many out-of-town guests here and everyone is always impressed w/the food.  I've been to many other Indian restaurants around the valley...but this is the one I always come back to.  The following are some of my favorites from this restaurant:  curry eggplant palak paneer malai kofta vegetable manchurian naan dosa

LV2YTxltFuHzpYfSENVzIg.text: first of all, i'm not too familiar with Indian cuisine so take my review with a grain of salt... or a grain of curry powder?  Haha...  you had to order and pay before sitting down... which isn't my thing but whatever... no biggie.  they had an Indian Movie on which the employees seemed to be enjoying.  Ballywood baby!!!  Neway, on to the food.  So I got one of the lunch combos... I think it had: *curry with tofu (tasted like a tomato base, i liked it ok) *a rice dish with green beans (was kinda weird texture but good flavor) *another rice dish with potato (this one i liked the best, spices were nice) *2 broth-y soups (one was very spicy with not much else goin on, the other was good, not sure what the heck was in it though) *some kind of porridge dessert that was...meh.  tasted like really sweet cream of wheat with cream.  but it was cold and very gelatinous.  not my cup of tea.... and speaking of tea...  i also ordered a hot tea... but I should have asked what it was like cuz both Monty and I thought it was horrible.  it tasted like dirt.  no i don't eat dirt... but what i would imagine dirt would taste like with a few spices added and hot water.  eew.    three stars cuz its wasn't horrible over-all, but i prolly wouldn't go back.  i wish i liked it better... but even Monty, who loves Indian food said he's had way better... so he's on a mission to introduce me to better stuff!

HRjB0jJueJeabDSONuaQmg.text: My family and I ate over here in July 2013.  It is by far one of the best South Indian Vegetarian restaurants in the valley.  The food was fresh, served HOT, and spicy for us.  We ordered what we thought was enough, but actually the portions are very big.  We couldn't finish everything.  Unknowingly we over ordered.  No big deal.      It is a great place.  It is a more like a chat house rather than a formal restaurant.    If you want fancy spoons and forks and plates and a high bill, this is not the place for you.  Best and most of all, the food was EXCELLENT.    The food was so good I wanted to meet the owner and also had the privilege to do that as well.    As expected, a nice fellow with a pleasing personality.  Give it a try once.  You won't be disappointed.  Mike

KnFuVRP2SJFssvJVA0xgJA.text: I went to this restaurant after a recent health kick, and had heard some good things, so I decided to check it out. The restaurant is more of a order at the counter, fast food looking atmosphere. I ordered the gobi manchurian, and the paper masala dosai. Let me just say, the gobi manchurian is one of the best things I've put into my mouth. And it's vegan! The dosai came to our table, and it was unbelievably big. Humorously so. But really tasty. The staff was really friendly, and I can't get enough of the bollywood music videos. Really great food. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Gobi manchurian and paper masala dosai.

fTzpChH85aypUinkbq98lg.text: I tried this place based solely on the reviews. Turns out the food was delicious, and the prices are more than reasonable. I paid $8.50 and ended up with enough food to feed three people! I will become a repeat customer, for sure.

M8ck6Z3uVpZk4RVx0XxBGg.text: only reason for 1* is he/they forgot some items in my to-go orders twice and had to go back to pick them. so if you place a to go order, make sure you got everything. i had dessert missing once and idli&vada missing next.

UeXfcC7vqDpdQjiUt84vYw.text: Great little vegetarian restaurant. The crepes are the size of fan blades!  My only complaint is that everything is styrofoam and plastic to eat with and upon, which makes me feel a little guilty.

A5j0vf9ZaTAYsSu0DXNeGw.text: Went again for lunch! Yuuummmm yummmmm Polished off a huge bowl of Curry Eggplant! Its so fucking delicious!!! Hawaiian guy and Indian girl i went with loved it as well.   It IS a bit more spicy then your run of the mill average Indian joint. So be aware of that. I am sure they will be happy to tone it down for you, but then, of course, you toning down your experience.   I loved it as is. Its awesome and i am sure as hell coming back!  PLEASE!!! P L E A S E do not listen to retards who bash this place for various stupid non-related shit!!! Stop by and try it. I brought half a dozen people there at various times and not one walked away disappointed - From actual Indian people to Alabama hick, to Scottsdale snob to average Joe.

I1y6NW1Oge6FvPss-jiWPQ.text: Easily the best indian food in Arizona.

IJXCHRZ5KgcbnNX4cjVIDg.text: Woodlands reminds me of the Mysore Woodlands in Chicago up on Devon Street.  Casual atmosphere of ordering upon entering, disposable plates & containers, and no traditional server/waitress to deal with.  Food is among the best in Phoenix for South Indian Fare and prices are within reasonable ranges as well.  Staff was very friendly.  Location is on the NE corner of Ray & Rural, facing the west.

0StfIAJc3zkYZvXdO38m4Q.text: If you haven't had South Indian food in a long time and miss it, well this is the place to go. Clean, Friendly and Affordable place unless you are there with a party of 10 and expect a happy Hour Environment. Don't be shy to ask the man behind the counter for something you need or any recommendations if unsure.   Start with Samosas with green and red chutni, then move on to Dosas (Masala or Plain) with Idli, Vada and Sambar. Try the Coconut chatni. A nice cold Mango lassi to go along the way and if you make it this far then nice Gulab Jamun or Kheer for Dessert.

ueUPhB_KNbT9LszPDGoW1A.text: Finally writing a review after I have been eating here for a couple years now.  This place is hands down the best south Indian food you will find in the valley.  They do such an incredible job with the spices.  The owner is really nice, he remembers that I cannot eat raw onions.  They did not even know that they were nominated for best vegetarian restaurant this year in the New Times, it was just business as usual.  Do not go here expecting to have a fine dining experience, you order at the counter, either take it to go, or sit in the dinner atmosphere and eat some crazy good food!  Friendly atmosphere, lots of families in to eat.  Everything is great, but the paneer butter marsala is one of my favorites.

bSkH3sDp42pJtuZSSCe9Pw.text: Really excellent food. The malai kofta is as good as any I have ever had. They have several choices of dosa. Their mint chutney tastes fresh and delicious (and is not too spicy, for those who want it milder). And yes, who does not love a chutney bar? The guy at the counter is not super friendly, and the place is certainly not fancy. The food, however, is terrific! It is as good as any really good Indian restaurant (Indian food is my favorite!), and the service is very fast. I noticed a lot of people there getting takeout, and also noticed half of their clientelle was Indian.

N8-rI5T8rvWqzXvaQ9MX_A.text: First I think it's important to say i'm not vegetarian.  I love indian food.  However, I am not missing the meat here!  Everything here is very flavorful and filling.  Vegetarian or not, if you love Indian food give this place a try!

mpkFxtHhrwLI3I_7IWeoqg.text: I ate here for the first time today with a friend who is a vegetarian/vegan - I however am not so I was skeptical.  I ate my words and my weight in paneer butter masala - the food was sooooo  good! We also had the dosa and the flat naan like bread (I don't recall the name) but I couldn't stop eating it was all so delicious. The chutneys where good and I loved the coconut the best although spice they had some delicious flavors - definitely a new favorite spot!

_pdtX4ff2VIHsP4OlGgW3Q.text: We ordered take out, due to the overwhelming reviews about "lack of ambiance". We figured it wasn't much of a date place, but have been searching for a good Indian food since our favorite closed months ago.  Woodlands did not disappoint. We ordered the paneer butter masala and the spinach dosai with a mango lassi. The lassi was delicious. I've been craving one for months. The paneer butter masala was creamy and thick, and delicious. We had never tried dosai before, and we were curious. This too was awesome. To top it off, they had also bagged some bread and chutney from the chutney bar. We didn't get to try to mint chutney; however, the white coconut chutney and tomato chutney were both very good.   There was also a soup in the bag. However, they had given us so much food, we were too full to try it. This place is delicious. I'm already eager to eat my leftovers for lunch tomorrow. Superb food, good portions, and good prices. Will definitely return.

k3n-TmFNBN1nBbZhzWAGvQ.text: Went for a late lunch on a saturday afternoon, probably about 1pm. I had to wait for 4-5 minutes for someone to take my order. looked like it was the manager or owner. he was polite. informed me they were out of a few things already. Thought that was poor planning being a holiday weekend and a saturday afternoon, but nonetheless, the food wass fresh and good. The sambar could have been a little thicker and was hoping for the food to be a little hotter (temperature related). Will visit again when I am in town.

1OI6o_bETUJcgOp9K9EGeg.text: OK, don't plan on being impressed with the atmosphere. You will be served on paper plates.  However, what is put on those paper plates in divine nectar! This is a big step above the original/famous Woodlands restaurant in Rishikesh (unrelated,I asked the owner in Rishikesh, & he is LIVID about all the imitations!) The food here is amazing. BEWARE: closed Tuesdays! (drove 2 hours from Chino Valley one time to find that out the hard way) Also, please note that "South Indian" means HOT. If you want it mild,you need to tell them. The owners are very sweet & attentive,as well as the Mexican waitress. Always packed full of Indian customers = authentic. The only Indian restaurant I found in AZ to compare to this one is the Govindas in Tucson. This is a family run business (the owners are the cooks,& you can watch them prepare the food) Best food,best price. Very clean. I love Indian food,& this place is great.

dqQqnUyZYptz6t40sVp21A.text: A very good place to try Indian vegetarian food. Don't miss out the chutney bar. Never been disappointed with the quality of food.

2mnsLdqMX21ZOJaq2VJXLA.text: Oh, the food. I would say it is on par with Anandas. It is spicy, more of a kick than seems typical, but I like it like that. Where I start deducting points first is the overuse of styrofoam and the very non-sustainable serving process. Most everything is served in styrofoam, even the drinks. The eating utensils are very small and very flimsy plastic. This is a deal breaker. I can forgive the non-friendly demeanor of the guy behind the counter, and the below par ambiance. But considering they're investing very little in the experience, the prices should also reflect this. Love the food, really tuned off by everything else.

5chPepKdNvwKTSPIjqUBmw.text: Super awesome, no complaints. Lived in tempe for almost 9 yrs, and this place has been consistently good. Service, food, is perfect. They have probably the best dosa variety and taste in the valley, and the also have the best Gobi Manchurian IMO. Their pongal is amazing too! The thing is, most places degrade in terms of quality or quantity over time, but this place hasn't changed a bit. Thanks to their family owned and run business! It's not the most luxurious restaurant or it doesn't look fancy etc, but it does have good food, which i find very rare around here.

UJEm-EP6owe30SPMnBoFnw.text: Same stuff as any other South Indian restaurant. Nothing special. Styrofoam, paper plates and plastic silverware etc. 4 stars if they got rid of the wasteful plastic silverware, paper plates and styrofoam and went with the classic stainless steel plates you find at other places. Good spot if your vegan and in a pinch for something to eat.

nNz4Qpl5JWcfJuTfzrnK-A.text: Reasonable prices. Flavorful vegetarian dishes. I wish I could tell you more about the dishes, but I don't know much about Indian food. We ordered a curry dish and a dal dish plus a rice dish. It also was served with white rice. It was more than enough for two people and 2 meals of leftovers! I would return for sure.

mNka4WWNorEyQcJdKf-TBQ.text: This is probably my favorite place to get Indian food in Arizona. The food is authentic, you get large portions that store well and taste great the next day, and the people are friendly and helpful. If you are considering giving this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

ZzVt9zwC5KSV996hI2dQcA.text: The food is Good.    3 - average  I had vada sambhar, panner butter masala, rice roti. by taste all things are good   Presentation crap    1 - bad Really shady place, bad arrangement of tables, sambhar is not free, it is really outragious as all the places in san jose, long beach, LA from where my friend is they have free going sambhar  Service below the ground    -3  below reference They should ask for tip if they deserve, if they think we do not deserve a good service, they they do not deserve a tip. my friend asked twice and was waiting for next serving of rice for 15 minutes, it is not that we were in hurry but one can take a break from eating.  overall - 3 tables occupied, a guy standing at door doing nothing, self service dhaba place, pay first -  eat later. Zero in name of service.

iSS1uPWxWGPCSDFxkByu-w.text: My couple friends from India spoke badly of this place.  However, upon reflection, I can't think of a time where any Indian friends, have ever given a favorable review of any Indian restaurants.        I ate here and loved it.  I got the Dosa with spinach filling.  Of course I doused it with with tons of chutneys too.  I loved it.  Nice and spicy!    Every Indian I know always compares it with their mothers cooking.  Of course each Indian is from a very specific part of India and the cooking varies regionally.  So I guess I can no longer listen to my Indian friends regarding Indian restaurant reviews.  I mention this because I think it might be a cultural phenomenon, which many others might confirm....?

vX-R4P2bwTjqKA9tSuwA9A.text: Good food but some items didnt taste the way it is supposed to be like Pav bhaji. Dosas here are good!Some upgrade required.

kH_Fgm93SJsK0b0ct1RQ9A.text: I love this place, it's a great way to get authentic Indian food fast. You order at the counter and they take the food to you so it's great for when you need a quick lunch or dinner. Food is sooooo good!

y5m17_Zu-tn_mQLKQxws7A.text: I've had regular dosa, paper dosa, rava dosa, vada, idly and sambar and all have been consistently good. Their chutney is self-serve and they also serve raita and chopped pickles as condiments, which is a nice touch. I first discovered this place around 2013 and try to go there when in the area. Their masala chai is also very nice.

BpdyGp14dj7rb0wR8_blPA.text: The quantity is too small. We ordered 2 spl thali but it was not sufficient for one person.the taste is not too good .they should  increase the quantity of food atleast at a moderate amount because the rice they give can only be sufficient for a 3 year old

H49s3ZRYuQ2sFitx0SUvIg.text: the food was very good and my indian friend said it was really authentic.  the only reason i am giving lower stars is that i specifically had called ahead to ask if they could make the food vegan for me (meaning no ghee).  i was told yes when i called and when i paid for my food i requested the same thing.  but when the food came it was full of ghee.  i know the taste of ghee and i know what my digestion feels like when i eat animal products.  i actually was surprised they said they could make it without ghee as usually the saag, dhal, etc... is made earlier that day.  i wish they would have just told me the truth instead of not being honest about it.   if you like ghee and are not vegan- the food is great!  but if you are vegan for any reasons- health, spiritual or otherwise- i am not sure i would trust them to tell you the truth about whether they could make you vegan dishes or not.

giCu9BOQyfVMedhsQ03igA.text: So after reading the reviews.,i wanted to check this place out today. Ordered pav bhaji dosa. It was good.spicy but good. Parota kurma , it was oki. Next was the twist , i tried vegetable briyanj. Sad thing rice was undercooked. So have to send bk. Next tried poori masala. Masala was bit old i guess.it tasted funny. Mango lassi was good. Overall try dosa maybe . Would give it try another time.

DgV7lMQdS6ltZzm_v8hEYQ.text: Love the pav bhaji dosa and the paneer dosa. Have been here more than 10 tines and eveytime I order same food.

kWjeRHXoNrEFfOCxKAczDw.text: Dosa's here are super duper delightful.. Have tried mostly all the dishes available they all r delicious in every bite.. Do take your water as they run out of mineral water most of the times :-)

WD2twVGWVNWV9Clqrp-laQ.text: First time at an Indian food spot. Delicious. Amazing flavor. Although we winged it on what to order - both things we had were amazing! Definitely will be coming back!

6Pa64gvboemRjr4nEwVVjw.text: First time dining here and last.....First impressions are usually right. When we got to the door, it was so gross, I didn't want to touch it.  Not familiar with the words and being vegan, they helped us and changed our order to not have cheese or dairy which we appreciated very much.  Everything is served on paper or Styrofoam plates with plastic utensils. Even the water comes in Styrofoam.  Don't they know Styrofoam is not recyclable and stays in the land fill?  The food was just okay to me.  We had gone to Udupi in Tempe a week before and I was wanting to go back for their vegetable green curry.  Udupi is the same price, everything is labeled vegan, it is cafeteria style so you can taste everything if you want.  Woodlands was closer to home, but I'll gladly drive a few minutes farther to eat at Udupi!  Very upscale.  Woodlands compares to McDonalds.

nYVMerB1Wczz22ddW6ZbQA.text: The panneer dosa was good but the other dosas weren't great. It would also be better if the guys behind the counter are a little more kind and courteous

DsFMuE-ViYHcRY6G6Bvb5g.text: First, the positives.  The food I had was very good.  Gobi Manchurian, Dal Curry, and chapati.  There were many vegan options available, clearly marked with a * next to the item on the menu.  There's next to no decor here, and no ambiance to speak of.  And I thought the food was overpriced, especially for lunch.  But the Styrofoam and plastic ware really turned me off.  They go straight to the landfill after one use, no attempt to recycle here...  Reusable cups, plates, and silverware would be a much better choice.  I am in no hurry to head back.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

Lbp1KSCTp2-aKGZSQPVPKQ.text: This place has good south indian dosa . we ordered pav bhaji dosa, spinach dosa, sambar vada everything was so delicious specially green chutney and sambar we loved it. We took chicku shake for to go it was average it was very sweet and not thick. So i recommend having dosa there

0B3dU9dFGF-1sSrMEX1yNQ.text: AMAZING FOOD! Atmosphere isn't fancy and food is ordered up front and served on plastic plates but it is authentic home-cooked South Indian food. Try the dosas.

5qRu2GfFL_LRqOqs9K1YBQ.text: I stopped in today for lunch and it was very good. Like many good Indian restaurants, it smells amazing the moment you walk in the door. Quiet and non-pretentious, you just walk up to the counter and place your order for South Indian vegetarian cuisine. My friend recommended I try one of their dosas. I'm gluten-free, so I double checked if it was made with flour. Happily, the lovely woman explained it was like a pancake made of lentils. Mine was enormous - three times the size of the plate - and filled with potato and peas. Delicious and highly recommended. I will be going back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Look at the size of their dosas!

nxqL7-qC6qdRbCVesS-DdA.text: I was pleasantly surprised with their chutney bar, wow, so many amazing chutneys to try. I can't really comment on the hot factor since I don't really consider a ghost pepper to be particularly hot, so you're on your own there.   The giant dosa we received was filled with a potato filling, and was very delicious. The paneer butter masala was creamy and flavorful, but not overpowering. The customer service was very friendly and they seem to have very cheap lunch specials that allow you to sample some of their best dishes!

-RZerxg6nwWh9y067Z78hg.text: If you are vegetarian or vegan with a flair for authentic South Indian food, this is the best place!!! Perfect quality and right taste!!!

T42VGr59LY22HYI3actESQ.text: Yes! Now this is some good south Indian food!  South Indian food is pretty different from North Indian food. Most people think of chicken tikka and palak paneer when they think of Indian food. South Indian food is almost always vegetarian, even vegan, and uses some different spices so the flavor can be pretty different.  Woodlands is small, the restaurant lacks ambiance, and the interior can be dirty. That being said, the food is fresh, well seasoned, and yummy. My favorite appetizer is iddly (steamed rice and lentil patties that are very simple in flavor but should be dipped in sambar, which is easily described as a spicy vegetable soup). Vada are deep fried pieces of lentil and flour dough that are also dipped in sambar.  For entrees, a masala dosa is a wonderful thin crepe like bread stuffed with potatoes (also served with sambar). Woodlands has lots of different types of dosa if you feel adventurous; I like the mysore masala dosa as it's a bit spicier. Vegetable uthappam looks like a big pancake and it's covered in veggies (again, served with sambar!). This is really yummy and filling.   I haven't had the other entrees here but I will definitely be trying the uppuma, channa batura, and poori masal. I would give this place 5 stars for food, especially in Phoenix where Indian restaurants are few and far between, but the dirty interior knocks it down a star. That being said, if you set reasonable expectations, I think you'll be glad you gave Woodlands a try.

lmMjxIYxa1WH1FymYnIJpA.text: Worst experience, they don't serve what they mention on their menu. While ordering Paneer dosa, they put tofu in the dosa instead of paneer. 2 time same experience. Owner says they want to cut on cost, if they really want to then they should change their menu item to tofu dosa. They are ruining the customer experience!!!!!!!

uGfQA5qzG3s9G_3xQWTeWg.text: Absolutely THE best masala dosa in Phoenix. If you are vegetarian and want great Indian vegetarian this  is a MUST STOP restaurant!  We will be back!

E550d2_3i4YYghrEG1ah0Q.text: I was craving some good, authentic Indian food, and this place is close to my work and has great Yelp reviews, so I went here for lunch today, Thursday, around 11:30 a.m. Let me tell you, it hit the spot!  Casual atmosphere: I ordered at the counter and then took a seat, where the food was brought to me.  There's a self-service station with water, plastic flatware, a variety of chutneys, raita and pickle. The food is served on disposable plates/bowls. There are a couple of trash cans around for customers to clean up after they're done.  The place was neat and clean.  Food: I ordered the 'Special Thali' lunch special and 'Malabar Parotta' side. I didn't wait long for my food, but I was also the only customer there.  Everything was DELICIOUS. The Special Thali came with an awesome mixed vegetable curry, a channa curry, rasam, sambar, only one chapati (but at least it was big), plain white rice, one plain papad, and one gulab jamun for dessert. I finished everything on my plate(s) except for some rice and rasam, but I'm not a big rasam fan to begin with.   The elusive 5th star: although I ordered 'Malabar Parotta,' what I received was not Malabar parotta but instead store-bought Malaysian paratha. Now, I love store-bought Malaysian parathas. In fact, I often have a family pack of them in my freezer that I feed my family periodically. So I had no problem gobbling up the yummy Malaysian parathas served at the restaurant. It's simply that I had my heart set on authentic Malabar/Kerala parottas that I haven't eaten in a long time, and I was excited to see it on the menu, so I was disappointed that I didn't get what I ordered.  Menu: The menu on their wall may be a little different than their paper & website menu because there wasn't a 'Special Thali' on the wall menu but a 'South Indian Thali' offering a slightly bigger food/drink variety. I'll ask about that the next time I'm there.  Future visits: Would I go back? Absolutely! I'm looking forward to trying out the rest of their menu.

AlTzF4-u01wiHDm_Dqyu3g.text: Ordered take out here last night because we had a hankerin' for some quick Indian and it's near our house. We love Indian food and have been slowly working our way to all of the restaurants near us. This place was THE best. It might be the best I've ever had. We ordered palak paneer, malai kofta, and dal curry. YUM! It was the right level of spicy. It was also beautiful to look at, especially the dal. I adored the veggie dumplings in the malai kofta, spectacular texture and taste. My mouth is watering just thinking of the leftovers in my fridge and I just had breakfast. I actually called the restaurant back after we ate last night to tell them how much we loved the food. Tomorrow we are having people over specifically so we can order this again to share. Highly recommend this place. The entrees are a couple dollars cheaper than other Indian places around, and it's much much better. (Shhh, don't tell them they could raise their prices and I'd still buy it!) Have never actually eaten in the restaurant. It doesn't seem like anything fancy, but I promise you won't care once you taste the food.

CRsYdhC-sg2VYuXp7Q9j9A.text: This is South Indian fast food, but prepared in an actual kitchen and with a sit down area. But the food is served hot and fresh and the portions are great. Prices are low and they have a chutney bar - what's not to love? I had the lunch thali with dosa, vadai and idli and payasam for dessert. The sambar was okay, but the winners were the three chutneys. Excellent food served quickly.

YB8grfb7PJDi-lHXzQmplQ.text: Yum! Love this place. The owners are really nice, and the food is delicious!  Good deal for what you get, too. I have really enjoyed everything I've tried, and they are always really helpful at helping me pick new dishes to try that I might like. The ambiance is not great, but it is super clean. I think this is the best Indian food in the area, and a definite must-try if you haven't been and like Indian food!

UtQe-jqz98UfuKVB7UBPmg.text: Woodlands serves freshly cooked indian food at very affordable prices at around $7-10 per each main dish. My friends who are originally from India recommended this place and took me here while I was in town visiting them to enjoy some great South Indian Dishes. There's a small chutney bar where you can get your favorite chutney just to snack on or to dip your favorite bread/crepe in thee, too.  We order Chole Batura, Saag Paneer, Masala Dosa and Chole Chaat + Mango Lassi...they tasted terrific! :)  The store is very low key and the ambiance isn't that great (there are just around 10 tables at most and you may end up sitting in front of the restrooms), but the food is super fresh and tasted great! (made from scratch daily and upon your order!).

2Zn4OpbVwmOgboFkQOaZSA.text: Come for the food! Only concern yourself with that and you will not be dissatisfied.  The look and feel if the place is just ok; but the prices are great, the food is exceptional, and really that should be your first concern. This is our second time here, and this time was even better than the first!

TTs7t2F1D192mbG2lzL3_g.text: The special veg thali was just OK. Nothing great. Quality seems to be going downhill.

A-UtXgf8_VdgR6isbGNy7g.text: Fantastic little Indian food restaurant. Don't be discouraged by the strip mall location or the abundant use of paper cutlery and styrofoam. What it lacks in pomp, it makes up for in flavor.  I ordered Palak Paneer with white rice and it tasted like heaven, especially paired with my friend's Paneer Butter Masala. The samosas are also a must, paired with savory and sweet sauces from the chutney bar.  All in all, four stars. I would be happy to recommend this place to friends.

HGcHnUFUhPlf9ZnkGwAmIg.text: Very ordinary food... Paneer Dosa is decent but very greasy... Idly was a disaster and chutneys don't even talk about it.. Bhel puri was decent ... This is my last option for any Indian food craving ... Not sure if I will go back there ... Service is pathetic ... Not a great place to enjoy food or ambiance ...

fbX8LGfndMm-J13kTOnxLw.text: Yup.. downhill we roll with desi restaurants... just as I sadly predicted in my previous review. Everything remains the same, thali was a cold disaster

hjnvpjL5eVtV90vwNtz0hg.text: I literally could NOT STOP EATING! I ordered the Chenna Batura, otherwise, curried garbanzo beans with puffy bread or even easier, #33. It was so satisfying that I ordered a second one to go so I could take it home and indulge over the weekend. The decor and ambiance was not the greatest, but really, who cares when the food is to die for. I will be making this my official "Place to go when I can not decided what I want to eat" because I know it will always be satisfying no matter what type of food I am in the mood for.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

R5QFxQdU2LeQyoZEd58-hA.text: I was stuck in a remote town in the desert of Arizona and desperate for some real food so we found this Indian restaurant listed about 40 minutes away and began the trek. Woodlands is a vegetarian South Indian restaurant located in Chandler, Arizona about 20 minutes south of Phoenix.  When we arrived, we immediately realized it wasn't all I thought it would be. Located in a strip mall, it was a tiny little take-out joint with inside seating for about 20. We took a look at the menu and were pleased to see items that were marked "vegan" so we ordered and took a seat at a booth. The restaurant had a plain interior with cheap tables and black chairs. Towards the back, there was a toppings bar with lots of options. We chose the hot peppers to add to everything we had ordered and waited for our food.  We started with the Iddly steamed rice and lentil cakes. These plain, mostly flavorless cakes were served with a somewhat-runny sauce that left much to be desired. That's not to mention that everything was served on styrofoam plates, which I only tend to see in cities in the middle of nowhereland. So weird.  For our entrees, we ordered two curries. I had the Vegetable Curry that had green beans and cauliflower in a coconut-tomato-based curry. My friend ordered the Dhall Curry, which had lentils with mustard, cumin, and spices. Neither of them were anything special.  And we also asked for super spicy, but they weren't spicy at all.  We also ordered the Parotta Kurma, which turned out to be really odd. They took the bread and sliced it up into pieces, then put a red curry on it. The bread was chewy and slightly spicy, but just odd.  All in all, it wasn't worth the drive out. The guy at the counter wasn't very helpful or personable. The meal was mediocre at best. And the entrees at $8.50 each really could be priced less for what we received. Oh, and the styrofoam and paper plates for those dining in the dining room were pretty tacky.

EVkbcrU_eJrJ0TDTGEqLxQ.text: Very good food! I got a curry and the bread it was amazing! Highly recommend this place! Seems traditional too.

Mw5i2Prr-yf3kgizRFZTlg.text: Worst Indian food we have ever had! No flavor, not fresh. Seemed like everything was just heated and served from packets. Almost puked on the mango lassi. We didn't even finish the food, ran away as fast as possible. Never heading near this place again!

MFw6YpcOCAWa2TcHU-UX5A.text: Horrible experience. Can't understand the high ratings. I am from south India and grew up this kind of food. First of all its criminal to make chutney, leave it out in a bar (esp. cocunut) and expect people to go get it. Next, all their food is served in styrofoam plates and plastic cups - that too tiny in size. I recommended a friend of mine (US guy) to have a "thali" so that he could have a more complete experience. Their "thali" came in a stack of two styrofoam plate layers. It was a joke. No one (incl. me) knew how to eat the food. To call this a south indian restaurant will be a criminal offense. Their lassis were untouchable. Extremely sour from having left outside and probably spoilt. To use Woodlands name and make a mockery of it is so sad.

gDAaPagsFhw1Ak-8QdW4UA.text: This is a no-frills storefront-type restaurant with counter ordering with food delivered to your table.  But this is the kind of place you go for the food, not for the decor.  The owner did a great job of explaining the differences between the dishes, and the food was really excellent.  As the title suggests, no meat here, but even the meatatarians in our group were pleased with the food here.  Don't miss the Samosas, Tofu Curry and the Vegetable Biryani.

GcPZeh8fmccHiwcTcD5lSw.text: Yummy! This is my new favorite Indian restaurant. Ordered #43 Vegetable Curry, #33 Chenna Batura, #29 Masala Uthappam and #57 Malabar Parotta and all were amazing! The Veggie Curry had a delicious sauce and lots of fresh tasting vegetables. It comes with a side a white rice and we used the Malabar Parotta (bread) to mop up the rest of the tasty sauce. The Chenna Batura looks like a huge sopapilla and comes with a garbanzo beans curry. This was a big hit w/the teenage boys who hogged it all. The Masala Uthappam was good, but the least favorite among us all. It's described as a rice & lentil pancake. It looked like a pizza and came with a sauce to dip it in. I wish I had heard about this place sooner. Excellent food... can't wait to go back!

1T0IQjP__4qS3igJTfdg0g.text: Fantastic food.   One star off for spork.  Really? How do you eat Indian with a flimsy plastic spork?  Get real dinnerware and I will change report to five stars.

21oEVE-wJ9YP9_JipmOHOQ.text: Masala Dosai and samosa chaat are legit. Good tasting food, authentic flavor.  I drive to Artesia (Pioneer Blvd) sometimes just to fulfill my Indian veggie food cravings (ok not really, but I do visit every time I'm in LA). This place compares favorably to those places. They have some interesting dishes that are like whitified versions of masala dosai, like, pav bhaji dosai? Maybe this really exists in India, I don't know, I wasn't born there and I haven't been there, but I'd like to think I'm very well connected with my parents culture. I appreciate my Indian heritage and culture. Anyways, I was surprised that the pav bhaji dosai was actually really good. Sambar is decent too. Chutney bar is good, but I think its a little lacking.  Service is kind of, I don't know, not very welcoming. Typical Indian style. If you're Indian, I think it will suffice, but if you aren't you'll be weirded out.   Phoenix really lacks south indian food places, this place somewhat makes up for that. Pricing though is not very appealing at all. ~$10 for a dosa with sambar is WAYYY too pricey. so much so that this might deserve a 2-star, but i gotta show some love for indian food.

wgBs8TNEsxMjnwnKMJrI_Q.text: I am South Indian by background.  Parents are from South India.  This food is very similar to what my grandmother, from Kanniyakumari, would make....just that my grandmother would not make as elaborate sometimes.    If you were to ask me about the food, I would say it is good, but my grandmother cooked better :-)!!  As far as what my wife and I ate, here is the breakdown:  1) I had a Mysore Masala Dosai.  This is very traditional from the Mysore area in India, where my mother's side of the family hails from.  The dosai was very similar to what I would eat in India, though a bit more elaborate  2) My wife, who is Vietnamese by background, ordered the Spinach Dosai.  She said it was good, as she is used to South Indian food.  I never really did see spinach dosai in India before though.    Regardless, if a person is adventurous, and you are not expecting the standard North Indian Mughlai fare, this place is worth going to.  I would go back. The atmosphere is more like a fast food, or cafeteria, but the food is good.  I do not want to compare it to elsewhere, as even I would say other places I have lived in the USA, including Chicago, have South Indian restaurants that can perhaps compete with this place and win.  For the Phoenix area, this is good though.

CkrQ_EzRGcJif_Fpkhj8Pg.text: Yum-may!  My mom comes down to Chandler twice a month, not to see me. She wants to go to Woodlands and eat their Malai Kofta and Parotta (bread).   This place has lots of Vegan options which are clearly labeled on the menu which is just divine for me. Regardless, if you are a vegetarian or not this is some of the best indian food I have ever tasted. I think the dosai is expensive but it tastes very good like everything.   Recommend the Chenna Batura, Poori Masal, Samosa, Mango Lassi and if you get curry or vegetables don't forget to order the parotta!@

okFXAUFLfogF_dOra850sA.text: The food tastes okay but the service is bad. Let me cite a couple of experiences (each with a different person): 1. A couple of days back, I ordered for pickup and noticed after reaching home that the dessert was missing. I called to let them know and all that he said was "Oh, sorry sir, I was talking to someone and forgot to pack it." I was surprised that he gave no offer whatsoever to try to make up for the mistake. I was going to say that I would take it the next time I go there but he hung up before I could complete! 2. While ordering two Dinner Grill Thalis, one for my wife and one for myself, I went back and forth a couple of times with substituting the Masala Dosa with a different dosa that costs the same. This was because my wife told me she wanted something else as she heard me order for her and then she said she'd go with what I ordered first. As I apologized for changing it twice albeit within seconds, the owner said quite rudely that this would be the last time! He said "I am allowing you to substitute and you are changing!" Firstly, he had told me in the past that they do accept substitutions for Dinner Grill Thali although not for the lunch grill thali and the Dosas were all the same price so he need not have made it seem like a huge favor! Secondly, I changed before he finished taking the order and the restaurant wasn't busy at all at that time!  At $8 for dosa, the prices are somewhat on the higher side considering that it is a self-service restaurant with styrofoam plates. But the Grill thalis (combos) are a good deal.

kWHvJEPEjegOA9vu5bT3jw.text: A friend told us about good South Indian food at Woodlands and she was right. It's a fast food place so if you are looking for a fancy restaurant this is not it. But if you are looking for good food, efficient and polite service in a family setting, you've found it.  We ordered South Indian Thalli. It was great. The rasam was "to die for".  Definitely recommended and we're definitely going back to try the rest of the menu!

KX-ls4FLf2ngTouUxF6DrA.text: The food was below average. The owner- the bald guy - was not very friendly. On top of that i found a screw in my spinach dosa and when i complaint about it, the owner calmly replied it must have come from a machine in the kitchen. I didn't hear any apology or any concern from my side. Had i eaten that, i would have to operated upon. Please stay away from this place !

Hdi6AiH7yE5VIr5dMAKFPw.text: I'm a regular to this restaurant. Being a south indian myself, I can vouch for their great quality south indian food.  My favourites here are the venpongal vadai, combo variety rice and vegetable uthappam.  The food is decently priced, delicious, served quickly and the manager is very friendly and willing to serve.  Though this is a small restaurant, Ive never had to wait to be seated.  There is not much of an ambience, but the food makes up for it.

gyI4jQU3IGPzCU6T7aNDmg.text: My vegetarian girlfriend insisted that I try this place (one of her favs) and since I'm always sucker for trying new places and craving Indian food I did not need much convincing.  From my friend's recommendation, I tried the Spinach Dosai whereas she had the Masala Dosai.  For our beverage, we shared the Sweet Lassi, which was very good.  This place is more like a "fast food" place so you order at the counter and sit yourself.  As the other reviewers have mentioned, the decor is not that snazzy but the place was clean, which is the most important thing.  I will definitely keep this place in mind.

R1w-ctF0vgvAuEctGe9tpA.text: Good South Indian food. Casual seating but that's fine when you don't need fancy place but want good vegetarian dosas  My last visit was not pleasant though.. there are lots of flies inside the restaurant especially on top of chatani area. Not very appetizing!

fsesfGwMpyzvYfL3a6p1NQ.text: We have lived in the area for 7 years learned of this place only 6 months ago. Turns out it has been open for 3 years upon talking with the gentleman running the place.  My wife is vegan; I am not but always up for tasty grub. This place did not disappoint. I had the #24 Chole Dosai while my wife had the #43 Vegtable Curry.  We also got a side of #57 Malabar Parotta (bread/naan) which is to die for and could be a meal in itself.   We were both so impressed with portion size (left overs came home for a much anticipated lunch the following day), flavor (loved the chutney bar), and friendly service. The gentleman on multiple occasions queried about or satisfaction.   I give this place a very solid 4; maybe 4.5. The only thing that would make it better in my opinion is the ability to order an Indian beer and if the prices were a little lower. The atmosphere is on the casual, informal side which I like. Our dinner was $20 for 2 with leftovers. Very reasonable for dinner for two.

Z7t6r7hrVqlC9AJtQu8NcQ.text: I really enjoyed the food here. We stopped in for a casual dinner after being highly recommended. I left happy, and WAY more full than I had anticipated. All those light, airy dhosas are deceptively filling.  Another reviewer was on point by saying that this spot isn't really a restaurant, but more of an eatery or dhosa shop. You order at a counter, take a seat, and your food is brought out to you. Pitchers of water are self-serve and there is of course a soda fountain. There is also a chutney bar where you can explore to your heart's content. We brought a sample of each back to the table. Each were delicious and fresh.   I got the palak paneer, which was delicious. My friend ordered one of the giant table-sized dhosas, of which they were happy to tone down the spice at her request. All in all, everything was great. The only thing I wasn't too crazy about was the plastic... everything. Our food was served in dixie bowls and all the silverware was plastic. It sort of felt like we were camping. The space is clean and bright, I think some real dishes and silverware would really round this place out. At any rate, I will be back.

XnxMC50ttNMYjuoJADBBxw.text: I'm not sure when this place opened, but I cannot believe it took me this long to get here!  They have a TON of vegan options and several gluten-free options which make them hella-rad in my book!   This is a pay-at-the-counter-and-eat-off-of-paper-plates type of place, which is fine by me because it keeps the costs down and the portions large!  I had the gobi manchurian (SO AMAZING) and the spiced rice. My dining partner had one of the platters and she was loving every bit of it.  I will be back... watch out!

PJ8sMBoTgXcdsBrxvwJj5Q.text: We had Vegetarian Thali at this place and what can I say other than "MIND BLOWING"...and did I mention mind blowing?  Also the quantity is a lot for one person. One of the best Thali I have had in US. Will definitely recommend people to try and a must for Vegetarians and south india food lovers. Very affordable prices!

OdYvIfai9qvD236J902Waw.text: Very tasty.  I had the vegan tofu curry.  Nice and spicy.  Not greasy.  My buddy had a dosa and sambar (sp?).  Both were good.  Also, a nice pickle/sauce bar.  Oddly, only thing not good was the rice, which was pretty bad--flavorless and mushy.  Next time, I'll get a curry to go and make some rice at home.  Fantastico to have an Indian place with lots of vegan options!

_2nDpUylTeYr4uef3B9yGQ.text: Woodlands is a well-known South Indian restaurant in New Delhi, India, so taking that name here in the States is kind of shady. Especially when there's not even a bare attempt to meet the same standards.   Anyway, Chandler's Woodlands serves primarily South Indian dishes. For the unfamiliar and unadventurous, there are also North Indian dishes on the menu (various curries, samosas, chole bhatura, etc.). There's no real atmosphere to speak of. You walk up to the counter, place your order, and receive your food on paper plates with plastic forks and knives.   I had the pav bhaji dosa, and some sambar-vada, both classic South Indian entrees (except that pav bhaji is a North Indian twist to the South Indian dosa concept). The sambar was bland, and not very interesting. It lacked the rich flavor that I expect, and was more watery than it should be. The dosa was fine. Because dosa is eaten with sambar, the bland sambar dampened my enthusiasm for the otherwise okay dosa.   The saving grace here is the prices, which are fair for the mediocre quality, lack of service, lack of atmosphere, and plasticware.

L52ZqQG7JZLvHgq2o1Fb7w.text: I just tried Woodlands and it's too bad I didn't try it sooner! Being vegetarian, it is very nice to have a place that prepares only vegetarian dishes. The options on the menu are endless, and when I first looked at it, I wanted to order everything! I got the Palak Butter Masala and another dish (I can't remember the name) that consisted of curried chickpeas and came with a delicious puffy bread. The food was so delicious!  All of the sauces had a remarkable flavor! The Chai tea is also tasty! I would highly recommend this place.

Aq5yqC9e9tVMuArrxHgUgA.text: No frills, order then sit down. Disposable cutlery you get yourself and styrofoam dishes. You come here for the food and I thought it was excellent!  I had the South Indian Thai.  A sampler plate of six wonderful dishes.  And rice. And a dessert. And a chai.  And a super price.

ny8yRr_rxzSpHvsPP5rHEQ.text: A nice crispy dosa is something that cannot be rushed. I am in love with the standard masala dosa as well as the spicy versions (pretty hot stuff). The chutney bar offers cilantro, tamarind, coconut (my favorite) and pickles and onions. This is a no frills, only thing to look at an enjoy is the fresh and excellently prepared food. No waiter service but who needs that? This place is affordable and the food authentic. If you are in a hurry, this isn't the best place to grab a quick meal.

UCsL5vVETZXsbKoVnToK6w.text: Very casual place for Lunch. Quick counter service. My GF and I ordered the lunch specials...mine was the Moli Kofhta - veggie balls in a spicy sauce. It came with rice and she ordered bread to share to dip it in the sauce after. This is not a fancy lunch, very low key and meals are served for quick throwaway on styrofoam bowls and plates...You can tell it's a family run place, hubby and wife...glad to support local businesses.

2JaTQ6CTI-jxC9lui2Nk5w.text: Woodlands is a run down looking fast food restaurant on the outside but a hidden gem of delicious flavors. I fell in love with the southern indian food here because of the rich and full bodied flavors that their chutney and dosa fillings have. I highly recommend any of the Dosa as the crepe ingredients are crispy and fluffy at the same time. It also comes with a soup with some lentils and spices. The soup is one of the highlights of the dish which pairs well with the excess crepe. I have personally had the tomato and the potato and onion varieties which were both fantastic. I would like to try their rice dishes in the future, as my memory has eluded me when it comes to the curry dish I tried months ago since the dosa stand out much more. The prices are fair for 1 item since you'll probably pay somewhere close to $10 per individual. My only qualm is the fact that the water is near a trash can by the back and the chutney on the sides usually look like they have been there for a while. Otherwise, I thoroughly enjoy the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

pMTgMIRY76P2NXjN_iC5zA.text: The pav bhaji dosa. Just. Try. This.  Love how they mix the Indian food like pav bhaji and paneer with a dosa. Very innovative and tasty. Also their gajar halwa.  They have a nice spread of different chutneys, the tamarind and coriander ones are superb!  The place is a little small so it's crowded at peak hours. But hardly any waiting. And totally worth the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Amazing pav bhaji dosa. Love their colorful and Desi style!

89we-XHCX83tFaP45W-rOA.text: Ate there 2 times during a few days spent in Chandler and the food is great! I noticed a large amount of East Indian folks in there eating so I'm thinking it is probably authentic. The samosas were outstanding and they only cost 3.99 for 2 very large ones. I will definitely return when in the area!

BnbqSBi1zjy2r7OVphd7Rg.text: Hello, We visit woodlands almost once a week, their food is as fresh as it can get unlike other indian restaurants. One can taste that everything on the menu is made from sctrach vs using canned junk. My 3 year old loves their paneer dosa, idli, all types of rice & chikoo milk shake.  The owners are friendly and always have a smile on thier face and greet the customers & make them enjoy their meal. Bottom line is this is the best restaurant in the valley that serves fresh tasty authentic food .

j9SFrjV8Xp6krssqCoF_Gg.text: How about some veggie type dishes? Here is a great place to make your kids or adults eat some type of veggie - with a couple notches of spiciness! This time around I ate the masala dosa which is a crispy like crepe filled with a potato mix $8, a paneer dosa - rice crepe filled with layers of paneer and onion $8. Also Paneer butter masala curry made with tomato onion in sauce with homemade cheese (the paneer) $9. Ended lunch with carrot halwala dessert made with shredded carrots, dried fruit and milk and sweets less than $3

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sambar vada
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Veggie Manturian
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carrot halwala dessert

IArtcJfXwbkGPT6Mdv8vsg.text: Poor Service, poor decor, and dirty bathrooms. The food was not good either, will not be returning.

3tXs1Diczmx2m50Ynie7Dw.text: Very good and fresh. The restaurant could use some updating, I take it to go, not the most fun restaurant atmosphere. Excellent traditional Indian food. Smells beautiful in the restaurant. I am vegetarian, so I was happy to find this as a new option.

4s_iBnYkPZT7NX2nUCxAaw.text: Vegans beware the menu has items marked vegan by using an asterisk but when ordering the man at the register said a little milk is used. Owners need to look up the definition of vegan I think they have it confused with vegetarian. Made us very uneasy to trust eating there. The atmosphere was a little dirty and the food was literally served on styrofoam plates and paper bowls.

yJteIjbCZcBbkhtdEUcEUQ.text: Traveling on business to chandler, so happy to find this restaurant. The food is authentic, I ordered a bel puri and a masala dosa, which is a lot of food for 1 person. I took half my dosa back to the hotel. The chutney bar is a great touch and I sampled the coconut chutney and tamarind, both were super good. I will be coming back, lots of things I want to try including the kulfi.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bel puri and masala dosa

WZkuGw8JP-63Z6zZ_SCrrQ.text: "Best South Indian restaurant in Chandler Area ( Not your typical fine dining place ). It wont offer you Romantic Candle Light Dining Experience. It is a Basic Maintenance place - they serve their food in Plastic Plates and coffee in Plastic / Styrofoam cups ( Yes i am not a fan of it too )  BUT - if you a True South Indian food lover , this should be your Go - To place.  They have the yummiest ghee Roast Dosa's and softest Idli's. Their Crispy Vada's are to die for and is my personal all time favorite. Their Grill Thalli Special offers all of these plus a dessert and coffee/tea for 10 $ at Dinner Time. Simply Love it !  They also have the best Sambar loaded with veggies.  Tasty Coconut chutney and spicy tomato chutney are offered as sides and one can get as many refills as they wish.  Being an authentic udipi restaurant - they Bisibele bath and Veg Pulao also is really good.

Poe6jf6RHQFFhB-G1ZAsng.text: I was there with 2 friends on a not  so busy night. Where do I start. The food.  Ordered vegetarian uttapam . It was raw on the inside. Sent it back and said to myself they cannot mess up a dosa and they did... stale oil and overlooked. Sambhar had spice but tasted old and stale. The ambience.., why does the owner have kids running behind the counter. The woodlands in India is a brand name that is held in the highest standards of South Indian food. This was awful.... stay away. Did not see a health certificate posted. Stay away

qLEqKNZZbkLN29qSdnet-g.text: Woodlands is one of my favorite places to grab lunch. I first learned about it from a fellow Indian coworker who was vegetarian and that was the only place he frequented.    It's a pretty plain joint (not too big on the decorations, you'll note), but the food is outstandingly flavorful.  Now don't be fooled and think that just because it's vegetarian that it is going to be completely 'healthy'... that is a very common mis-conception and can really eff up your 'diet' if you have that mindset and eat at places like this frequently.. cuz I tell ya, they are pretty generous with not only the portions, but to give food some sustenance, you can bet they use cream or ghee (basically butter) to thicken sauces up and the likes.  This food is flavorful, for sure, but low in calories it is not.  I have tried a few of their Thalis (basically sampler dishes which lets you try a variety of things in one sitting and in smaller portions, but still really filling), the Palak Paneer, the Currys, the Aubergine dish called Bharwan Baiga, Gobi Manchuria.. they were all super delicious... though the Aubergine dish is still my favorite!  Plan on taking leftovers... oh yeah, and the prices are pretty decent and the staff is pretty good, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Milakai Kofta #48
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Palak Paneer #47 and a side order of Malabar Parotta #57
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Top: paneer butter masala: Bottom: veggie curry

55gp7BDsAIO-x0PqGGzIgg.text: The food is absolutely amazing. However, keep in mind it's SOUTH indian food, which means it's on the spicy side. I had the lemon rice and also the Dosa with spinach filling.  Of course I doused it with with tons of chutneys too. (Sorry Scott B, I plagerized from your review) I loved it.  Nice and spicy!  I also got the cauliflower with chili sauce.  YUM!!! Don't expect ambiance, it's all about the cooking. My Indian friend loves it, she raves about this and drives from N Phoenix to the Woodlands about once a week.   Definitely go and give it a try!

4oGqt-kx0OxyUFMVL2Rc1g.text: I have been wanting to try this place for years. Finally got a chance and it was far from stellar. My curry was fine and my girlfriends dosa was fine too. The "lentil" soup had zero lentil in it and about a ton of salt. For $30 I expect to eat off of real plates and use real metal utensils. I don't want a styrofoam plate and paper bowl. Glad I finally marked this off the list. There is much better indian food in the area.

u-8DnkLFV9mVOyjDW9bTEg.text: Their ghee roast dosa here is amazing! It is one of the best dosas i have ever had! I 10 out of 10 recommend this resteraunt! They make dosas in a jiffy!

ZyEaM0vg4C9wm2Nye5aqBg.text: Prompt recommendations upon request, great condiment bar that is free! The spinach masala dosai is fab

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dahi (yogurt) vadai done diff in that it was mildly sweet.
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spinach masala dosai was awesome non std concoction.  Beautifully crafted and the coconut chutney is best.

wybEdbTtK6yfBxCgzy9pVg.text: If you don't have an idea of what to order you will be in trouble. The owner Shawn (Indian) is very friendly but if not asked will only take your order.   If you seat yourself and are waiting for one of the workers to wait on you you will get the message to self to go order at the counter.   You have to order at the counter and then seat yourself.  You will be served on a paper plate. Don't let the discourage you. The food will make up for your prudish ways.   This is authentic Indian cuisine. The entire menu is vegetarian and is tasty.   3. Grill Thali* was very good.  59. Vegetable Briyani* was very good.  Didn't care for the white dough.  The Mango Shake was delicious. (If you like Mango)  NOTE TO SELF: Research the menu before attending.   Lunch time is way to busy with the Intel Employees. Wait until after 1pm or 5:00pm when they reopen.  Restaurant is closed on Tuesday.  Open 11am-3:00PM reopens at 5:00PM-9:30

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Front sign

1IMQH7TWMZN7h5rcaIMx7g.text: Holy moly this place packs flavor! It's really surprising, and a new little gem for me. The dosai was fabulous, and the soups were bomb (I don't know the True names). I loved the self serve chutney bar, and the pickled veggies they had there. This place is a must try, and as always, they had lots of Vegan options.

7_GqHk7APDFzCP-2vn-ucQ.text: Very tasty southern Indian vegetarian food and fast service as well! Wish this was a full service restaurant!

uTE6hbTcgILCRy90ePtRZQ.text: I was excited about going to an all vegetarian Indian restaurant. I give this place a 2.75.   We had the palak paneer and woodlands dosa. The dosa was good...but I didn't know that there would be a whole onion! I don't eat onions because of religious purposes. Sometimes, I can pick around dishes that do have onions, but this was just jam packed with it. I realize I could've asked what sort of vegetables were in the dosa, but their menu offered very little explanation. The palak paneer was good...but lacking in paneer...we had about 4-5 pieces in our dish. It was also much too spicy for my liking.   When we left the venue, our insides were on fire and felt as if we needed to chug ice cold water to tone it down. We were full, but not satisfied...  I do love that they have a chutney bar and plenty of water pitchers for customers to pick up on their own.  Ambiance and service quite spotty. I don't think we'll be returning, but still glad we gave it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

J18fkW9m5iffKmrP7CXTDQ.text: The food was unbelievable delicious with perfect amount of spices. The portions is very generous and we will definately come back to try more.

M2-8bQ-KWnaTOpjqQexUdg.text: This is by far the best spot for a South Indian tiffin around the area.  The food is prepared fresh.  The podi dosa is outstanding.  The poori is amazing.  Everything is great for the south Indian Palette.  The only advise is to eat it there hot and fresh to get the best out of the food.  I make it here atleast once a week.  Enjoy the lovely food

dffqVxBqffxV5CDfBYctaw.text: I must say....  I've been to many an Indian spot...  this place is special.  It starts with the chutney selection.   Amazing.  I've been here twice.  The first time I had stuffed eggplant curry-  i just couldn't believe how delicious!    Tonight I tested them and tried third the fluffy pastry and garbanzo curry - wow!    Just superb!!  This is a great find folks!

hN4jqG_Y4tV8Hqg1SY9G4g.text: Last remaining good South Indian place - I think.   It is quite far for us, but we make the 40 mile trek from Cave Creek to this place for the Dosa & Sambar. We love the food that has become harder and harder to find in the area.  Prices are on the high side for the fast food kind of setup they have, but I will pay for the quality and... I am not a fan of disposable Styrofoam they use for everything.

2CuxEBM-7sWxLAuEITnI7A.text: This cute place on ray road serves authentic south indian fare.It's vegetarian and reasonably priced. They serve more than 10 varieties of Dosa.The Pav bhaji (rice crepe with pav bhaji masala and onions) and Mysore masala (rice crepe with spicy chutney,potatoes and onion) are my favorites.All Dosa's are $7.99. I recommend trying the Mysore masala if you can handle a little heat.  We also got the South Indian Thali for $9.99.It comes with rice,sambar,rasam,three types of curry,pappadum,tea/coffee and sweet.For sweet they gave me Gulab jamun (which i love). The chutney bar is nice.The portions are generous,you can also order the thali's to go.  They would totally be 5 stars if they could get rid of those styrofoam plates because i feel it gets really messy especially if you are eating the Thali. The interior is basic nothing fancy but the food i would say is very close to Home.  Cheers!

BQdYzoG_9rOPowZ0W9ER6A.text: Will not recommend this place. I have had way better food. The paratha that they give is literally frozen chapati and it is more than $2. Came here for the first and last time.

bpQVCri2kCu5CoOUAxBhYg.text: I think I got this restaurant confused with another one initially because I was expecting a buffet. When I walked in and saw there was only a chutney bar I didn't mind too much since there were lunch specials and the menu looked intriguing. Since a lot of Indian restaurants here serve North Indian style cuisine it was a nice change of pace to try South Indian style dishes.  There are currently 3 different lunch specials. Quite honestly at the time I didn't know half of the dishes that were listed on it but I got #5 special thali lunch simply because it had the largest number of items. :) The #5 ($7.50) includes rice, chapati, sambar, rasam, porial, kootu, papadum, and dessert. I asked for it to go and it was made in just a few minutes. I also looked up the what each dish was so I could identify them later. :)  Each dish had a distinct flavor and was good with either the rice or the chapati flat bread. I enjoyed the spicy bold kick of the sambar soup, the delicate taste of the kootu lentils, and the mixed vegetable porial was probably my favorite of all the dishes. The rasam soup was a little too sour for my tastes, but that's just me.  Dessert was a delicious sweet mango(?) pudding with very thin, dark noodles. Very unique and the first time I've had this particular dessert!  I also ordered a mango lassi which was a sizeable portion, with rich, tart mango and yogurt flavor.  Sadly I did not receive any papadum (thin crispy lentil wafers) with my order but I was pretty stuffed eating only half of my order anyways so it didn't matter too much.  Overall I loved the food here and they aren't afraid to kick up the spice level. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. #5 special thali lunch to go
Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mango lassi

XNqv-y6x_jkHNqsL4o0Ubw.text: Had a lot of expectations from this place but it didn't live up. We ordered meals and chilli porotta. The meals were supposed to be south indian, but had aloo mutter and chole in the dishes. The sambar was disappointing to say the least. The curries did not taste bad , but overall nothing great. Chilli porotta was like porotta in a gravy and was not the consistency generally expected in the dish. On the whole, never going back to this place.

pteMFRtJM0GDEESXCkup7A.text: Positive point: Very good place to enjoy South Indian food!!  Neat and clean restaurant and very good quality of food!  Negative point: Owner never greet you with smiling face!

sGxIkMgyV-xMkB3kyGMW4Q.text: Decent South Indian food. But extremely bland even for someone like me who prefers less spicy food. Average ambience.

HF3wo0rZUNp2gm1-bN6LPg.text: Delicious, unique, healthy, and inexpensive!  We frequent this restaurant often, and I feel great about supporting this family owned business.  If you like Indian food, you will be pleasantly surprised by the selection of items here.  They have some common options, but also dishes that are not typical of most Indian restaurants.  We like to take friends here that are foodies or want to try something different.  Try it!

oqO8JkgqucCEQ23oQx6cKw.text: Awesome place to visit very welcoming staff Food in the restaurant is simply superbly delicious. A must place to visit. Come fall in love with  woodland restaurant love it

Y15KiiQiqbZufQvjvsOv9A.text: Bright flavors, expansive menu, generous condiment bar and Styrofoam plates.  This is a great little veg Indian spot, which is an order at the counter, and they bring it to you format.   All of the usual (non meat) options are here plus some other treats like Dosa's and Thali plates. A thali plate is a great option for those who can not decide as it they are like a mini sampler complete with several small cups of food and a few starches to go with it. Top on to that some of the great coconut chuney from the condiment bar and you have yourself a party in on your table.   When looking at the menu realize that this place is authentic and if something is on the spicier end, only order it if you like spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

P2yWBKvGvyDRhpDWQhZcVw.text: My boyfriend used to work right next door to Woodlands and said he would come here all the time to get the VEGETABLE CURRY. since I've never had curry I was a little hesitant But let me tell you.... I REGRET NOT COMING HERE SOONER! we ordered the food to go and the food was SOO HOT and delicious. We also had the mango shake which was delicious as well. Literally tastes like you're biting into a fresh juicy mango. Come here. If you are looking for something new to eat COME HERE. if you love Indian food but have never been here. COME HERE! You won't regret it....... and it's vegetarian !!! But as for you meat eaters, You will not feel like you're missing out. The customer service was great too. Greeted us with a huge smile and was SOO kind. I am so happy I decided to try Woodlands! Sorry my food was pretty much done when I snapped this picture

photos.caption: Photo of Woodlands Vegetarian South Indian Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

OivMntR5R3DWqvD4bV05YA.text: Great South Indian food at good prices. Very casual atmosphere, they serve food on disposable plates. Chutney bar with mint, tomato, tamarind and coconut chutneys. The dinner specials provide a good variety of food if you don't know what to get.

gsPOXy1FEhvcbTIIt3q5_Q.text: This is a typical South Indian vegetarian restaurant. I called them when they were about to close but they took my order n allowed me to have the crispy Rava Masala Dosa in the restaurant.  Enjoyed eating Dosa after long time.   It's a must try place.
